comments.body:
I know nothing about the underlying library, but it looks like `false` might also be a valid value?
https://github.com/nodemailer/mailparser/blob/9636083b806e60a953a640a4f833a700931b5618/lib/mail-parser.js#L137

You're right. `Headers` doesn't allow for a `false` value either despite being initialized as false. Both should be fine though - this is an email parsing library - receiving an email with no headers is highly unlikely (from, to, subject, etc. are headers).
